channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Waste all over Craig’s Court, 9th November
item.description:
Bike blocking fire exit at the back of Silver Cross bags cardboard and other rubbish next to bins, feces urine and crushed glass on the pavement and the road- why is it acceptable to tolerate this blatant abuse of public space ? can the council please remove St cleaners bins from here and require businesses to keep their waste inside their premises till just before collection instead of dumping it for days to come !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Great Scotland Yard, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste in Craig's Court blocking fire exits, 9th November
item.description:
Waste blocking fire exit between BT exchange and great Scotland Yard Hotel - reported weeks ago - still there... bottles and other rubbish on the fire escape stairs at the back of hotel -and old shades pub. drugs paraphernalia urine feces in between bins - why is this tolerated for so long !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Great Scotland Yard, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa dumped by the side of the road., 9th November
item.description:
Sofa dumped by the side of the road. Please can this be cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 176, Burnt Ash Hill, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over Craig’s Court, 9th November
item.description:
Bags of leaves dumped by Street cleaner in household and bins bags of rubbish dumped by the pubs feces urine drugs paraphernalia in between bins crushed glass everywhere -how is this acceptable especially given it's rememberance day and the whole of Whitehall was clean ? ! why is it acceptable that all these businesses and St cleaner gets to dump waste for days and nothing can be done !? remove some bins , fine businesses who fly tip - rlthis has to end !!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Fridge still not collected., 9th November
item.description:
Somebody reported this dumped fridge on 13th October but it still has not be removed, despite this update from Lewisham Council: "Added to Fridge Collection List for Week of 23/10/25. State changed to: Internal referral. Posted by Lewisham Borough Council at 14:04, Wednesday 15 October 2025" Please can this dumped fridge be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Senlac Road, Chinbrook, Grove Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle without registration plates, 9th November
item.description:
Vehicle parked on Disabled spot for over 2 months. Has no registration plates and is under cover. Has been reported on 16 October, 2025 Service Request number: PEF-1073363. Nothing changed since then, owner doesn't care.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shrewsbury Lane, Shooters Hill, London
